Ingredients.1: 6  green bell peppers, tops and seeds removed (reserve tops)

Ingredients.6: 1 (16 ounce) can tomatoes, chopped and liquid reserved

Ingredients.11: 1 dash hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®) (Optional)

Directions.1: Chop reserved green bell pepper tops. Measure out 1/4 cup and set aside.

Directions.2: Bring a pot of water to a boil; cook whole green bell peppers in boiling water until slightly tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and lightly season inside of bell peppers with salt. Set aside.

Directions.3: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef, onion, reserved 1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper, and garlic in the hot skillet until ground beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes; drain and discard grease.

Directions.4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Directions.5: Stir canned tomatoes and liquid, rice, water, Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon salt, hot sauce, and black pepper into ground beef mixture; bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover the skillet with a lid, and simmer until rice is tender, 15 to 18 minutes.

Directions.6: Stir 3/4 of the mozzarella cheese and 3/4 of the tomato sauce into ground beef-rice mixture. Stuff bell peppers with ground beef-rice mixture; top each with remaining mozzarella cheese and tomato sauce. Arrange peppers in a baking dish. Cover the dish with aluminum foil.

Directions.7: Bake in the preheated oven until cooked through and cheese is melted, 30 to 35 minutes.
